alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 8:17PM CDT until March 30 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Alabama River At Selma affecting Dallas County. .Flooding continues on the Alabama River and a flood warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by Wednesday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Alabama River At Selma. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Pasture lands below Selma become flooded. At 45.0 feet, Extensive overflow of low lying lands in the area begins. Some low roads in the area begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 41.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 45.0 feet Thursday morning and then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 45.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
